                            </gmd:organisationName>
                            <gmd:role>

                    </gmd:citedResponsibleParty>
                </gmd:CI_Citation>
            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>Global warming is causing large-scale transformations of the northern landscape. In particular, permafrost thaw has wide implications for northern ecosystems and the communities living in this transitioning landscape. As climate continues to warm, previously frozen soils may release carbon and nutrients to aquatic ecosystems. These environmental changes may push aquatic ecosystems beyond tipping points, so that the functions and services they provide to communities are at risk. This project is directly addressing concerns about changes in water quality expressed by community members in Fort Good Hope in the Sahtú Settlement Area. We used a YSI multiparametric sonde and 2L polycarbonate bottles for water sampling. Ultimately, the results from the project will help anticipate cumulative effects of climate warming and anthropogenic disturbances such as land-use on aquatic health.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

                            </gmd:westBoundLongitude>

                            </gmd:eastBoundLongitude>

                            </gmd:southBoundLatitude>

                    </gmd:geographicElement>

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-3k29-vs78
notes: Global warming is causing large-scale transformations of the northern landscape. In particular, permafrost thaw has wide implications for northern ecosystems and the communities living in this transitioning landscape. As climate continues to warm, previously frozen soils may release carbon and nutrients to aquatic ecosystems. These environmental changes may push aquatic ecosystems beyond tipping points, so that the functions and services they provide to communities are at risk. This project is directly addressing concerns about changes in water quality expressed by community members in Fort Good Hope in the Sahtú Settlement Area. We used a YSI multiparametric sonde and 2L polycarbonate bottles for water sampling. Ultimately, the results from the project will help anticipate cumulative effects of climate warming and anthropogenic disturbances such as land-use on aquatic health.

notes_translated.en: Global warming is causing large-scale transformations of the northern landscape. In particular, permafrost thaw has wide implications for northern ecosystems and the communities living in this transitioning landscape. As climate continues to warm, previously frozen soils may release carbon and nutrients to aquatic ecosystems. These environmental changes may push aquatic ecosystems beyond tipping points, so that the functions and services they provide to communities are at risk. This project is directly addressing concerns about changes in water quality expressed by community members in Fort Good Hope in the Sahtú Settlement Area. We used a YSI multiparametric sonde and 2L polycarbonate bottles for water sampling. Ultimately, the results from the project will help anticipate cumulative effects of climate warming and anthropogenic disturbances such as land-use on aquatic health.
notes_translated.fr: Le réchauffement climatique entraîne des transformations à grande échelle du paysage nordique. En particulier, le dégel du pergélisol a de vastes répercussions sur les écosystèmes nordiques et les collectivités vivant dans ce paysage en transition. À mesure que le climat continue de se réchauffer, les sols précédemment gelés peuvent libérer du carbone et des nutriments dans les écosystèmes aquatiques. Ces changements environnementaux peuvent pousser les écosystèmes aquatiques au-delà des points de basculement, de sorte que les fonctions et les services qu'ils fournissent aux communautés sont menacés. Ce projet répond directement aux préoccupations concernant les changements de la qualité de l'eau exprimées par les membres de la communauté de Fort Good Hope, dans la zone de peuplement de Sahtú. Nous avons utilisé une sonde multiparamétrique YSI et des bouteilles en polycarbonate de 2 L pour l'échantillonnage de l'eau. À terme, les résultats du projet permettront d'anticiper les effets cumulatifs du réchauffement climatique et des perturbations anthropiques telles que l'utilisation des terres sur la santé aquatique.

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.

title: CIMP 215: Aquatic ecosystems in the Fort Good Hope area as indicators of environmental change

title_translated.fr: CIMP 215 : Les écosystèmes aquatiques de la région de Fort Good Hope en tant qu'indicateurs des changements environnementaux
